Posts.Content: Thanks again for all the good advice. I was not aware of a PCA 3 test or a free psa. Did some research and it is still a bit complex. Should I pursue a biopsy or have these two tests done first? My URO wanted to observe the DRE again and I guess a decision will be made at that point....it is two weeks out.
Posts.Title: First Time User - Seeking Advice

Posts.Content: The Uro was the one that found the nodule. He did not have an answer for my urinary frequency but gave me some medication to try. Once he found the nodule he did not seem as concerned about the urinary issue. The meds he gave me have not worked at all. My family dr. also tried some medication about 3 months ago with no success in preventing numerous trips to the restroom. I'm 52 and I go back to the URO in 2 weeks for a follow up exam. I was just curious what it meant when a PSA doubled in a short period of time.

Posts.Title: First Time User - Seeking Advice

Posts.Content: I'm seeking some initial advice a hope that in the end I will not have an issue. I recently saw a urologist for urinary frequency at night (every hour). The visit also yielded a positive DRE and a PSA of 1.5. Six months ago, my family Dr. did a PSA and it was 0.80. I go back to the Urologist in two weeks to have another evaluation. 1. Should I be concerned that my PSA doubled in 6 months? What might that mean? 2. Should I have a biopsy or wait another few months to see what my PSA does? Any advice is greatly appreciated.
Posts.Title: First Time User - Seeking Advice

Posts.Title: First Time User - Seeking Advice

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone for the advice. The PSA 101 article was excellent. I have a follow up appointment in December and will be checking back from time to time. I will definitely discuss the antibiotics with my URO. He already mentioned the possibility of a biopsy from the initial exam. I guess he wants to confirm his initial findings through another visit. He did not know my PSA when the exam took place. Thank you!
